name: Pecans
properties: Among the highest antioxidant content of all tree nuts
Excellent source of manganese and copper
Contains vitamin E, zinc, and B vitamins
Rich in flavonoids and phenolic compounds
Contains ellagic acid and other polyphenols
benefits: Supports heart health with healthy monounsaturated fats
May help lower LDL cholesterol levels
Supports brain health and cognitive function
Helps with satiety and weight management
synergies: Pairs well with bananas and oats for breakfast
Combines with walnuts in desserts and toppings
Works with berries for enhanced antioxidant benefits
Complements cacao nibs and other nuts
amount: ¼ cup chopped or 2 tablespoons per serving (about 15-30g)

quotes: STOVETOP OVERNIGHT OATS WITH BANANAS AND PECANS
STOVETOP OVERNIGHT OATS WITH BANANAS AND PECANS - MAKES: 4 servings
sprinkle with chopped pecans and a swirl of Date Syrup (if using)
chopped pecans, chopped walnuts, sunflower seeds, pumpkin seeds, chia seeds, hemp seeds
¼ cup/30g coarsely chopped pecans or walnuts (optional)
¼ cup/30g coarsely chopped pecans or walnuts (optional)
